meanings.definition: The quality or state of being burdensome or oppressive.
meanings.sent1: The onerousness of carrying heavy bags made her tired quickly.
meanings.sent2: The onerousness of the task caused him to feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent3: The onerousness of having to wear a heavy costume to the party was comical.
meanings.sent4: The onerousness of the rules felt like a weight pressing down on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The onerousness of the mountain of paperwork made him dread going to work.

meanings.definition: Something that is difficult to bear or deal with.
meanings.sent1: The onerousness of the decision weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent2: The onerousness of the long journey ahead made him hesitant to start.
meanings.sent3: The onerousness of having to eat broccoli for dinner was amusing to her siblings.
meanings.sent4: The onerousness of the situation felt like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The onerousness of the math problem made her head spin with confusion.
